Arizona State University has given me the opportunity to be a leader by running and shaping the technology support department whose expanding clients currently include all the students who live on campus and the Housing Department staff.- Act as primary point of contact, sole FTE, and supervisor of all PTE for department tech support team at this location- Provide tech support through remote access, chat, email, phone, and in-person- Active Directory management- Image PC's and run updates both on-site and remotely with SCCM- Manage permissions and content in Shared Drive and SharePoint- SharePoint Site Admin for department, assisting clients with finding solutions, configuring web parts, workflows, and contolling permissions- Use of Chat clients such as Adobe Connect, Bomgar, Skype for Business- Assemble and troubleshoot hardware including PCs, modems, routers, Ethernet hubs and switches, projectors, PA systems, and conference room equipment, and printers (including driver installation and networking)- Implementation and use of CRM software like Salesforce and ServiceNow to improve response time and customer relationships through metrics- Create reports to get metrics to leadership- Assist clients with merging to Office 365 Exchange and configuration- Offer support with Microsoft Office suite and other software- Equipment inventory management, control, and security with Computrace- Equipment lifecycle management through device rotation- Developing documenting department procedures and support workflows- Work with vendors to find solutions, gather quotes and order new assets, and troubleshoot issues.- Strong organizational and communication skills. - Hire, train, develop, supervise, and schedule all new IT staff.

Apollo Education Group has allowed me to explore my passion in technology and helped me enhance my abilities in tech support and as a developer. - Created, maintained, and supported client solutions in Microsoft's SharePoint CMS which in turn saved the company money by becoming less dependent on 3rd party solutions and their licenses. - Participated in AGILE project management and all aspects of the sdlc from start to finish.- Acted as my own project manager working directly with stakeholders to gain requirements, create storyboards or flow charts, and give progress reports to management. - Gained experience in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Rest, AJAX, and PowerShell.- Deliver customer service as an Analyst, troubleshoot issues, configure new websites with OOTB web parts, create search queries, or custom code.- Part of the migration team to move the company's intranet from SharePoint 2007 to SharePoint 2013. - Heavy use of Microsoft Office Excel, Word, and Outlook to create reports, analyze the data, and form dashboards which offered a simple visual of the team's progress

Leadership and Responsibility summarize my years as a Lead Radiologist Assistant and Assistant Manager for Associated Radiologist Ltd, and East Valley Diagnostic Imaging. Radiologist Assistants would act as liaisons between the radiologist, client businesses, and patients while offering customer service and handling medical records.  I hired, trained, and supervised 12 employees which helped increase customer satisfaction and accuracy. I managed the workflow of 40 radiologists across 6 hospitals, and 5 outpatient imaging centers to help increase productivity. Additionally I assisted in scheduling staff and physicians, setting up meetings, creating and implementing new policies and procedures, and completing quality assurance. Hospital technology and systems were used including PACS radiology systems, and Radiology Information Systems. I assisted IT in setting up new medical software and trained staff and physicians on it to assist the company's transition from paper medical records and film images to being fully digital (paperless).

As a retail sales associate with Sports Authority I operated the cash registers, stocked inventory, set up displays, stayed informed about all up to date sports equipment and products, and provided excellent customer service that led to return customers and increased business.

I was responsible monitoring patrons and provided customer service to all patrons to help provide a safe and friendly environment. I was trained in life saving techniques, swimming abilities, and CPR.
Participated in several intramural sports including basketball, flag football, volleyball, weight training, and racquetball.

Biology degree with lab and report writing experience. Many additional courses in chemistry, physics, business and psychology (including upper division levels). Received Academic scholarship and worked full time through college to graduate without any debt.
